1.title: Introduction
1.description: Genesis which means beginning. It tells the story of how the world began and how God created all things, including animals of different kind and human beings both male and female., Moses, the Prophet, and the leader of Israel was an author of Pentateuch. The first book is Genesis. He wrote Genesis, Exodus, Leviticus, Numbers and Deuteronomy. All together known as Torah which means law., Bible doesn’t tell exactly when and where Genesis was written, but it was probably written by Moses during the years of Israelites encampment in the wilderness at Sinai., And it may be written to early Israelites after their Exodus from slavery in Egypt before they entered to the land of Canaan.

1.title: Introduction
1.description: The Book of Joshua does not explicitly name its author. According to the Biblical researchers, more likely Joshua the son of Nun, the assistant of Moses as leader over Israel, wrote much of this book. Bible does explicit about this, but probably, the latter part of the book was written and compiled by other person after the death of Joshua. The book covers the period from the death of Moses till the promised land.

1.description: 00:09 YHWH Choose Joshua and What He Tells Joshua Tells the Israelites

10.title: Joshua 10
10.description: 00:10 The Sun and the Moon Stops Moving During the War, 14:39 Joshua’s Army Conquered Southern Cities in the Land of Canaan

1.title: Introduction
1.description: 1.The book is named for its central character, a Moabite woman, who forsakes her pagan heritage in order to cling to the people of Israel and to the God of Israel. Ruth is the Hebrew title of this book means “friendship or association.” This book covers 30 years history. It is an incident that happened in the days of the judges., 2. Because of her faithfulness in a time of national faithlessness, God rewards her by giving her a new husband, a son, and a privileged position in the lineage of King David and Jesus the Messiah., 3. Ruth and Naomi are the major personalities in the first two chapters and Ruth and Boaz in the last two chapters. And in the first two chapters Ruth’s love is demonstrated and in the last two chapters Ruth’s love is rewarded. This book is an illustration of godliness, real faith and obedience that leads to blessings.

1.title: Ruth 1
1.description: 00:09 Elimelech's family goes to Moab from Bethlehem , 02:04 Naomi and Ruth return to Bethlehem

2.title: Ruth 2
2.description: 00:09 Ruth meets Boaz in the grain field

3.title: Ruth 3
3.description: 00:10 Ruth asked Boaz to help her and Naomi

1.title: Introduction
1.description: The Gospel of Matthew consisting of 28 chapters written by Apostle Matthew also known as Levi, the son of Alphaeus. Matthew was a Tax collector, before he became the disciple of Jesus Christ., The purpose of his writing was to prove the Jews, that Jesus as the long-expected Messiah, the son of David, who established the Kingdom of God on earth., Jesus Christ fulfilled the Old Testament prophesies concerning the Messiah. To accomplish his purpose Matthew emphasis Jesus’ royal genealogy. The Gospel of Matthew was written between 65 and 75 AD in Antioch of Northern Syria.

1.description: 00:07 The Genealogy of Jesus the Messiah, 04:57 The Birth of Jesus the Messiah

1.title: Introduction
1.description: 1.The Gospel of Mark consists of 16 chapters, written by John Mark. According to the testimony of the early church fathers, John Mark is an associate of the apostles. He was able to learn about the life of Jesus directly from apostle Peter and wrote in large part on the information given by him.2. Mark was the son of Mary, cousin of Barnabas, and a colleague of the Apostle Paul.3. Purpose of his writing was to present Jesus as the ‘Servant Redeemer’ as prophesied in the Old Testament. 4.The Gospel of Mark was written in between 55 & 65 AD. Among the four gospels, Mark’s gospel was written first. And it is written in Rome.

1.description: 00:00 John Prepares the Way for Jesus, 03:41 Jesus Is Baptized by John, 04:55 Jesus Goes Away to be Tempted by Satan, 05:40 Jesus Begins His Work in Galilee, 06:34 Jesus Chooses Some Followers, 08:45 Jesus Frees a Man From an Evil Spirit, 11:05 Jesus Heals Many People, 13:23 Jesus Goes to Other Towns, 15:00 Jesus Heals a Skin Diseased Person

1.title: Introduction
1.description: The Gospel of Luke is consisting of 24 chapters and is written by Luke, a physician, and a Gentile.He was a close companion of the Apostle Paul in his missionary journey also remained with Paul during Paul’s imprisonment in Rome.When and where; Luke began writing his account on Jesus probably at Caesarea and finished it in Rome between AD 65 and 70.Luke was a Greek, a gentile, therefore, he has written his gospel in a way that gentiles (non-Jew) would easily understand.In addition to this gospel Luke also wrote the book of Acts. Luke was a physician, missionary (associated with Paul in his mission) and above all, a historian. He was very careful both in his gospel and in the book of Acts to give accurate historical details. Luke wrote this historical account on Jesus to Theophilus probably a Roman official to establish him in the faith in Jesus Christ. Theophilus was a believer and then the purpose of the book was edification of the saint.Luke presents Jesus as ‘Son of Man’ ‘Perfect man’ and the key words in this gospel is ‘Salvation’ and ‘Son of Man’.

1.title: Introduction
1.description: An introduction to the ACTS OF APOSTLES, AUTHORSHIP,Luke, the physician, is the author of this book. Luke was an eyewitness to many of the events in Acts. Traditionally he has been viewed as a gentile, he was primarily an evangelist. He wrote the Gospel of Luke and the book of Acts and accompanied Paul in missionary work (Col. 4:14; 2 Tim. 4:11; Phil. 24).DATE AND PLACE OF WRITING,Acts is approximately dated between AD 63 and 70. Key places for the writing may be Jerusalem, Samaria, Lydda, Joppa, Antioch, Iconium, lystra, Derbe, Phillipi,Thessalonica, Berea, Athens, Corinth, Ephesus, Caesarea, Malta, Rome.RECIPIENTS, Luke wrote to Theophilus (Acts 1:1). The address that Luke utilizes for Theophilus, “most excellent” in 'Luke 1' suggests that this individual occupied some high-ranking status in society.

1.title: Acts 1
1.description: 00:09 Our Father’s promise to give something to believers

2.title: Acts 2

3.title: Acts 3
3.description: 00:09 Apostles heal a crippled beggar and Peter speaks in Solomon’s portico

4.title: Acts 4
4.description: 00:09 Peter and John before the council, Believers pray for Boldness, Believers share their possessions

5.title: Acts 5
5.description: 00:09 Ananias and Sapphira, Apostles heal many, Apostles are persecuted

6.title: Acts 6
6.description: 00:09 Seven chosen to work and the arrest of Stephen

7.title: Acts 7
7.description: 00:11 Stephen's speech to the Council and the Council's response

8.title: Acts 8
8.description: 00:09 Saul persecutes the Church; Philip preaches in Samaria and to the Ethiopian Eunuch

9.title: Acts 9
9.description: 00:09 Saul’s encounter and His change life and Peter’s ministry in Lydda and Joppa

10.title: Acts 10
10.description: 00:10 Peter meets Cornelius and Gentiles receiving the Good News and the Holy Spirit for the first time

11.title: Acts 11
11.description: 00:09 Peter’s report to the Church at Jerusalem and they send Barnabas to meet the believers at Antioch

12.title: Acts 12
12.description: 00:10 James is killed, and Peter is delivered miraculously from the prison and the Death of Herod

13.title: Acts 13
13.description: 00:10 Apostles' ministry at Cyprus and at Antioch of Pisidia

14.title: Acts 14
14.description: 00:10 Apostles' ministry in Iconium, Lystra and Derbe

1.title: Introduction
1.description: An Introduction to the First Letter to the Thessalonians, AUTHORSHIP, Paul wrote 1 Thessalonians, writing with the agreement of Silvanus and Timothy. Paul was from the city of Tarsus and a Roman citizen. He had been known as Saul in his early life. Before becoming a believer, Saul was a Pharisee and a member of the Sanhedrin. He persecuted Believers. After he became a believer, Paul traveled several times throughout the Roman Empire, telling people about Jesus, supporting his ministry by making tents., DATE, PLACE & RECIPIENT, Paul probably wrote this letter in A.D. 49–51 while staying in the city of Corinth during his second missionary journey. He wrote this letter to the believers in Thessalonica.

1.title: 1 Thessalonians 1
1.description: 00:11 Paul's salutation to the believers of Thessalonica and the Faith and Life of Thessalonians

2.title: 1 Thessalonians 2
2.description: 00:11 Paul’s ministry at Thessalonica and his desire to visit Thessalonica again

4.title: 1 Thessalonians 4
4.description: 00:11 A Life pleasing to God and the coming of the Lord

5.title: 1 Thessalonians 5
5.description: 00:13 Advice to the Children of Light

1.title: 2 Thessalonians 1
1.description: 00:12 God will do what is right

2.title: 2 Thessalonians 2
2.description: 00:12 Evil things will happen but you are chosen for salvation

3.title: 2 Thessalonians 3
3.description: 00:12 Pray for us. Everyone’s duty to work. Final word

1.title: Introduction
1.description: The book of Titus in the Bible is a letter written by Paul to Titus consisting of three chapters. Titus was a Gentile and a Co-worker of the apostle Paul among the non-Jewish people. In this letter, Paul called himself as servant of God and the Apostle of Christ. Apostle Paul accompanied Titus to the Crete Island which is the largest Island in the country of Greece. The reason Paul left Titus in Crete Island is to complete the unfinished work for the Churches., Duration and Place of Writing, The book was written approximately dated between A.D 62-65., Paul wrote this letter to Titus from Nicopolis after he was released from his first imprisonment in Rome.

1.title: Titus 1
1.description: 00:00 Paul explains Titus's Responsibility in Crete Island

2.title: Titus 2
2.description: 00:00 Titus Must Teach the Word of God Truly to the Believer

3.title: Titus 3
3.description: 00:00 How a Believer's Life Must Show Good Example to the People?

1.title: Introduction
1.description: An introduction to the epistle of Jude, This epistle was written by Jude, the brother of Jesus, born after Jesus, a son of Joseph and Mary. Jesus’ brothers came to believe in Jesus as the Son of God later, after his resurrection., Jude wanted to expose the false teachers who had entered the Church and also, he wanted to encourage the Christians to stand firm in faith and guard themselves from the false teachings., Although it is one of the shortest books in the New Testament, the Epistle of Jude contains information that is not found anywhere else in the Bible. Jude portrayed Jesus as ‘Our Protector'., This epistle was probably written between A.D. 60 and 69 in Jerusalem.

1.title: Jude 1
1.description: 00:10 Greetings from Jude, 01:04 The Danger of false teachers, 02:43 Jude warns people that God will punish those who do wrong, 11:38 Jude encouraged believers to remain faithful, 13:22 Jude praises God for protecting the believers
